info.title: REST API for Oracle Eloqua Marketing Cloud Service
info.description: The Oracle Eloqua Marketing Cloud Service REST APIs enable you to extend the functionality of the product, build Apps, and perform high volume data transfers.
info.x-summary: The Oracle Eloqua Marketing Cloud Service REST APIs enable you to extend the functionality of the product, build Apps, and perform high volume data transfers.

servers.description: Use this server to connect to your local datacenter. Determine the baseUrl from the 'Determine baseUrl' (/id) endpoint.

baseUrl.description: Replace {baseUrl} with the baseUrl return from the endpoint 'Determine baseUrl' (/id)

tags.name: Application/1.0/Accounts
tags.description: An Oracle Eloqua Account provides group contact information. Learn more about accounts.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Activities
tags.description: Activities are tracked for individual contacts.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Contact fields
tags.description: Contact fields are the fields associated with a specific contact asset. Learn more about contact fields.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Contact list
tags.description: Customized lists of contacts.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Contact segments
tags.description: Segments API endpoints. Learn more about segments.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Contacts
tags.description: A contact is a data entity that contains the explicit data around an individual person in the database. Learn more about contacts.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Content sections
tags.description: Content sections allow you to create shared content to use inside assets such as emails and landing pages. Learn more about content sections.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Custom object data
tags.description: Custom object data are the records of custom object instances. Learn more about custom objects.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Custom objects
tags.description: Custom objects are a complement to the standard Data Entities (i.e. Contacts, Companies). Essentially, custom objects are used for two main functions: linking directly to a Contact and performing actions based on information collected without duplication. Learn more about custom objects.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Email folders
tags.description: Email folders organize your email assets. Learn more about emails.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Email footers
tags.description: Email footers are used to customize the look and feel of the bottom of your email. Learn more about email footers.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Email groups
tags.description: Email Groups are used to control default settings for similar types of emails. For instance, you can set the default header, footer, subscription landing page, and unsubscribe landing page for a set of email newsletters. Then your contacts can subscribe or unsubscribe at the group level to simplify subscription management. As an administrator, you can add or delete groups as required to control email subscriptions. Learn more about email groups.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Email headers
tags.description: Email headers are used to customize the look and feel of the top of your email. Headers can be used in your emails for branding purposes (your company's logo), to provide links to other (external) resources, or to display the link for a contact to view the email in a browser. Email headers are automatically added to your email after selecting and saving the email group to which it belongs, but you can also select a different header on a per-email basis from the email header chooser. Learn more about email headers.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Emails
tags.description: Despite vast innovations and improvements to other channels of communication with prospects, emails are still central to many marketing campaigns. You can reach a large number of existing and potential customers efficiently and cheaply through email messages. Eloqua includes robust email marketing capabilities that you can weave into your marketing campaigns. Learn more about emails.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Form data
tags.description: Form data are the submissions for a form. Learn more about forms.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Forms
tags.description: Form data are the submissions for a form. Learn more about Forms.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Images
tags.description: Image assets to be used in places such as emails or landing pages. Learn more about images.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Landing pages
tags.description: Landing pages are often the first significant part of a campaign that a contact will see. A contact may be directed to your landing page from a link in an email or from an ad on the web. The landing page provides the contact with more information and options related to the email or ad that brought them there. On the landing page they can be asked to participate in the campaign by reviewing detailed information, submitting a form, or clicking a button to receive additional information etc. The landing page moves prospects through your campaign and gives them a clearer idea about your product and your companies trustworthiness. Learn more about landing pages.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Microsites
tags.description: A microsite is a miniature website, often dedicated to a specific campaign, product, or keyword. The purpose is to give a visitor (whether channeled through your website, social media assets, emails, SMS, or other channels) precise information that they can use to better understand your products and services or to make a buying decision. There are three types of microsites: basic, secure and authenticated. Each landing page you create in Eloqua must have an associated microsite. Learn more about microsites.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Option lists
tags.description: Option lists are usually referred to on the marketers' side as select lists or pick lists. Learn more about option lists.

tags.name: Application/1.0/Users
tags.description: Users API endpoints. The API allows you to modify such things as a user's time preference. Learn more about user management.

tags.name: Application/2.0/Account groups
tags.description: An Oracle Eloqua Account Group provides the ability to group multiple companies into an Account Group. Learn more about accounts.

tags.name: Application/2.0/Accounts
tags.description: An Oracle Eloqua Account provides group contact information. Learn more about accounts.

tags.name: Application/2.0/Audit logs
tags.description: The Audit Log API endpoint enables initiating a request for Eloqua audit log exports using the Application API. Specify the type of audit log you want to export within a specified date and time range. If the request is successful, a report will be sent to the email address specified in the request.

tags.name: Application/2.0/Campaigns
tags.description: Marketing campaigns are at the center of the Eloqua application, campaigns are comprised of different elements (such as segments, emails, landing pages, etc.) that are used to perform a variety of functions. You can combine the different elements in a number of ways to customize your campaign flow. Learn more about campaigns.

tags.name: Application/2.0/Contact segments
tags.description: Contact segments are groups of contacts generated based on filter criteria and contact lists. Learn more about Segments.

tags.name: Application/2.0/Contacts
tags.description: A contact is a data entity that contains the explicit data around an individual person in the database. Learn more about contacts.

tags.name: Application/2.0/Custom object data
tags.description: Custom object data are the records of custom object instances. Learn more about custom objects.

tags.name: Application/2.0/Custom objects
tags.description: Custom objects are a complement to the standard Data Entities (i.e. Contacts, Companies). Essentially, custom objects are used for two main functions: linking directly to a Contact and performing actions based on information collected without duplication. Learn more about custom objects.

tags.name: Application/2.0/Email deployment
tags.description: The email deployment API is used to send and retrieve email deployments. There are two methods for creating and sending email deployments: to a single contact, or to a low volume of contacts (up to 100 contacts). Learn more about emails.

tags.name: Application/2.0/Emails
tags.description: Emails API Endpoints. Learn more about emails. Creating and updating emails with the type ResponsiveHtmlContent is not supported. If you use these endpoints with this email type, we cannot guarantee your email will be responsive.

tags.name: Application/2.0/Event registrants
tags.description: The event registration API is used to manage event registrants. Learn more about Event Management.

tags.name: Application/2.0/Events
tags.description: The events API is used to manage events. Learn more about Event Management.

tags.name: Application/2.0/External activities
tags.description: External activities are non-Eloqua (that is, offline) activities performed by your contacts or prospects. These assets can be imported for use in Eloqua campaign reporting. External asset types is the 'umbrella' (top-level) classification for something that your contacts or prospects are performing, for example, a Tradeshow. Learn more about external assets.

tags.name: Application/2.0/External asset types
tags.description: External activities are non-Eloqua (that is, offline) activities performed by your contacts or prospects. These assets can be imported for use in Eloqua campaign reporting. External asset types is the 'umbrella' (top-level) classification for something that your contacts or prospects are performing, for example, a Tradeshow. Learn more about external assets.

tags.name: Application/2.0/External assets
tags.description: External assets are non-Eloqua (that is, offline) activities performed by your contacts or prospects. These assets can be imported for use in Eloqua campaign reporting. Learn more about external assets.

tags.description: Form data are the submissions for a form. Learn more about Forms.

tags.name: Application/2.0/Visitor profile fields
tags.description: A visitor profile field are the fields associated to a website visitor. Learn more about Visitor Profile Fields.

tags.name: Application/2.0/Visitors
tags.description: A visitor is a data entity that represents a unique cookie. The tracked activity data from that cookie is associated with the Visitor. There can be multiple visitors linked to a single contact.

get.summary: Retrieve a user
get.description: Retrieves the user specified by the id parameter. For security purposes, full user details are only displayed in a response if the user profile being retrieved via the API is the same user performing the request.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the user to retrieve.

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: Level of detail returned by the request. Eloqua APIs can retrieve entities at three different levels of depth: minimal, partial, and complete. Any other values passed are reset to complete by default. For more information, see Request depth.

400.description: Bad request. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

401.description: Unauthorized. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

404.description: The requested resource was not found. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of users
get.description: Retrieves all users that match the criteria specified by the request parameters.

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: Level of detail returned by the request. Eloqua APIs can retrieve entities at three different levels of depth: minimal, partial, and complete. Any other values passed are reset to complete by default. For more information, see Request depth.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of entities to return. Must be less than or equal to 1000 and greater than or equal to 1.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specifies which page of entities to return (the count parameter defines the number of entities per page). If the page parameter is not supplied, 1 will be used by default.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Specifies the search criteria used to retrieve entities. See the tutorial for information about using this parameter.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Specifies the field by which list results are ordered.

parameters.name: lastUpdatedAt
parameters.description: The date and time the user was last updated. This is a read-only property.

204.description: No matching users were found in the search.

400.description: Bad request. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

401.description: Unauthorized. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

403.description: Forbidden. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

404.description: The requested resource was not found. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

500.description: The service has encountered an error. See Status Codes for information about other possible HTTP status codes.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of activities
get.description: Retrieves all activities that match the criteria specified by the request parameters. Note that the query parameters endDate, startDate, and type are required. See activity detail values for more information about the different activity detail values for each asset type.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Id of the activity.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of activity you wish to retrieve from the specified contact: emailOpen, emailSend, emailClickThrough, emailSubscribe, emailUnsubscribe, formSubmit, webVisit, or campaignMembership.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date and time (10 digit integer Unix time).

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date and time (10 digit integer Unix time).

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of entities to return. Must be less than or equal to 1000 and greater than or equal to 1.

204.description: No matching activities were found in the search.

parameters.description: Whether email components are dynamically populated upon retrieve. If set to true, email components are populated. If set to false, the default content of the email component will be returned. The default is true.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of emails
get.description: Retrieves all emails that match the criteria specified by the request parameters.

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: Level of detail returned by the request. Eloqua APIs can retrieve entities at three different levels of depth: minimal, partial, and complete. Any other values passed are reset to minimal by default.

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Maximum number of entities to return. Must be less than or equal to 1000 and greater than or equal to 1.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specifies which page of entities to return (the count parameter defines the number of entities per page). If the page parameter is not supplied, 1 will be used by default.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Specifies the search criteria used to retrieve entities. See the tutorial for information about using this parameter.

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: Specifies the field by which list results are ordered.

parameters.name: lastUpdatedAt
parameters.description: The date and time the email was last updated.

parameters.name: includeAvailable
parameters.description: Specifies whether to include unarchived emails in the results, considered true if not specified.

parameters.name: includeArchived
parameters.description: Specifies whether to include archived emails in the results, considered false if not specified.

post.summary: Create an email address import definition
post.description: Creates a new email address import definition. The Bulk API's emailAddresses import allows you to change the global subscription status of email addresses without having to create a contact. The global subscription status can only be changed to unsubscribed. When an email address is imported this way, any present or future contact in Eloqua with the same email address will be automatically globally unsubscribed. Alternatively, to globally subscribe an email address, the /contacts/imports and /contacts/exports endpoints can be used with a sync action.

auditReportType.description: Specifies the Audit Report Type to generate. Possible values include: assets (asset history), securityGroup (security group history), userProfile (user profile history), userLogin (user login history), dataExport (export history), and dataUpload (upload history).

startDate.description: The start date and time (10 digit integer Unix time). This property is required.

endDate.description: The end date and time (10 digit integer Unix time). This property is required.

notificationEmail.description: Email address for export notification. This property is required.

fileFormat.description: File format to be exported. Possible values include: delimitedFile or Excel2007.

assetTypes.description: The asset type for the Audit log. Required if auditReportType is set to assets. Possible values include: forms, programs, campaigns, emails, and landingPages. Specify multiple asset types by comma separating values.

actionName.description: The event action to filter for the audit log. Possible values include: all, create, modify, delete, archive and unarchive. For campaigns, possible values also include: activated, deactivated, pause, and scheduleForActivation. If not specified, defaults to all.

status.description: For dataUpload and dataExport audit reports, you can filter on the status. Possible values include: completed, in progress, queued, waiting, failed, and inactive.

userName.description: The user name to filter on.

You can request access to this feature by submitting a request to My Oracle Support.

isEmailMarketingCampaign.description: Whether or not the campaign is an email marketing campaign.

campaignCategory.description: Defines whether a Campaign is simple or multi-step. The value emailMarketing should be used for simple campaigns, and contact for multi-step campaigns.

firstActivation.description: The date and time the campaign was originally activated.

memberCount.description: The amount of members in the campaign. This property is only returned when depth is set to partial or complete. This is a read-only property.

type.description: The asset's type in Eloqua.
The asset's type in Eloqua.

The type of email deployment. Possible values include:
  • EmailTestDeployment
  • EmailLowVolumeDeployment
Note that the activity's Email Send Type will appear as QuickSend.

id.description: Unique identifier of the email deployment.

currentStatus.description: Current deployment status. Possible values are: normal, locked, forceComplete, inError, or resend.

name.description: The name of the deployment.

description.description: Description of the deployment.

permissions.description: Permission values of the deployment granted to the current user.

folderId.description: Id of the folder.

sourceTemplateId.description: Id of the source template.

createdBy.description: The login id of the user who created the email deployment.

createdAt.description: The date and time the email deployment was created, expressed in Unix time.

updatedBy.description: The login id of the user that last updated the email deployment.

updatedAt.description: Unix timestamp for the date and time the email deployment was last updated.

accessedAt.description: The date and time the email deployment was last accessed, expressed in Unix time.

scheduledFor.description: The date and time the email deployment is scheduled.

depth.description: The request's level of detail.

successfulSendCount.description: The number of emails which have been successfully sent so far.

failedSendCount.description: The number of emails which failed during send so far.

endAt.description: The date and time the email deployment ended.

sentContent.description: The content type of the email.

sentSubject.description: The subject line of the email.

type.description: The asset's type in Eloqua. This is a read-only property.

id.description: Id of the email. This is a read-only property.

currentStatus.description: The asset's current status. This is a read-only property.

name.description: The name of the email.

description.description: The description of the email.

permissions.description: The permissions for the email granted to your current instance. This is a read-only property.

folderId.description: Id of the folder.

sourceTemplateId.description: Id of the source template.

createdBy.description: The login id of the user who created the email.

createdAt.description: The date and time the email was created, expressed in Unix time.

updatedBy.description: The login id of the user that last updated the email.

updatedAt.description: Unix timestamp for the date and time the email was last updated.

accessedAt.description: The date and time the email was last accessed, expressed in Unix time.

scheduledFor.description: The date and time the email is scheduled for.

depth.description: Level of detail returned by the request. Eloqua APIs can retrieve entities at three different levels of depth: minimal, partial, and complete. Any other values passed are reset to complete by default. For more information, see Request depth.

previewText.description: The preheader text that email clients will use when displaying a preview of the email. 500 character limit. Different email clients will limit the amount of characters displayed.

senderName.description: The sender name recipients of the email will see.

senderEmail.description: The address the email will appear to be sent from.

replyToName.description: The sender name recipients of the email will see.

replyToEmail.description: The email address targeted when recipients click "reply".

bounceBackEmail.description: The email address which is notified if the email is undeliverable.

virtualMTAId.description: The numeric ID for the Virtual MTA configuration. Virtual MTAs are setup during the Branding and Deliverability package provisioning process. For more information, see the Oracle Eloqua Help Center.

plainText.description: The email's content in plain text.

isPlainTextEditable.description: Whether or not the asset's text is editable.

sendPlainTextOnly.description: Whether or not the sent email is plain text only.

isTracked.description: Whether or not Eloqua will track the asset.

isPrivate.description: Whether or not the email is private.

forms.description: A list of associated Form assets.

images.description: A list of associated Image assets.

hyperlinks.description: A list of hyperlinks contained within the email.

contentSections.description: A list of content sections contained within the email.

dynamicContents.description: A list of dynamic contents contained within the email.

fieldMerges.description: A list of associated Field Merges.

isContentProtected.description: Whether or not the email is in protected mode.

renderMode.description: The layout of the email when it is sent or previewed. Possible values include: fixed or flow.

archived.description: Whether or not the email is archived.

type.description: The asset's type in Eloqua. This is a read-only property.

id.description: Id of the field merge. This is a read-only property.

currentStatus.description: The field merge's current status.

name.description: Name of the field merge.

description.description: The description of the field merge.

permissions.description: The permissions for the field merge granted to your current instance.

folderId.description: Id of the associated folder.

sourceTemplateId.description: The id of the source template.

createdBy.description: The login id of the user who created the field merge.

createdAt.description: The date and time the field merge was created, expressed in Unix time.

updatedBy.description: The login id of the user that last updated the field merge.

updatedAt.description: Unix timestamp for the date and time the field merge was last updated.

accessedAt.description: The date and time the field merge was last accessed.

scheduledFor.description: This property is not used for field merges.

depth.description: Level of detail returned by the request. Eloqua APIs can retrieve entities at three different levels of depth: minimal, partial, and complete. Any other values passed are reset to complete by default. For more information, see Request depth.

syntax.description: The syntax of the field merge.

defaultValue.description: The default value of the field merge.

contactFieldId.description: Id of the associated contact field.

accountFieldId.description: Id of the associated account field.

eventFieldId.description: Id of the associated event field.

eventSessionFieldId.description: Id of the associated event session field.

customObjectId.description: Id of the associated custom object.

customObjectFieldId.description: Id of the associated custom object field.

mergeType.description: Type of the field merge. Possible values include: contactField, accountField, eventField, eventSessionField, and customObjectField.

customObjectSort.description: The associated custom object sort type.

queryStringKey.description: The key value if the field merge contains a query string. See the Help Center to learn more about field merges with query strings. This is a read-only property.

allowUrlsInValue.description: Whether or not URLs are allowed in this field merge. False by default. Using URLs in a field merge can be a security risk. By default, when Oracle Eloqua attempts to insert the field merge, it removes any URLs while still inserting the remaining data. However, you can override this security feature by selecting the Allow URLs in field merge check box in the Eloqua user interface.

type.description: The asset's type in Eloqua.
